channel.title: Click, Click Wdf I didn't do it
channel.description:
I put the cursor over anything sometimes it just randomly clicks without me doing it. cursor doesn't move. It just keeps clicking without me doing anything. Took me 20 mins to write this post. Help would be great to solver this problem.
Using a labtop.

item.title: Click, Click Wdf I didn't do it
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

this happened to me (SCREW WINDOWS VISTA)
(GO XP)
my dad did something to fix it but check the mouse in my computer

Read full topic
item.source: Click, Click Wdf I didn't do it

item.title: Click, Click Wdf I didn't do it
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“Buzzy, post:5, topic:106553”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=152544.msg1440815#msg1440815 date=1181138991]
Well, your either accidentally pressing the touch pad button, or tapping the touch pad it’s self, else it’s acting up and think something is touching it. Try to disable it and contact the laptop’s manufacturer if it’s still in warranty.
[/quote]

to add to this, try using a USB mouse for now on.[/quote]
If there’s a manufacter error and it tapping it’s self then using a usb mouse won’t solve the issue.

Read full topic
item.source: Click, Click Wdf I didn't do it

item.title: Click, Click Wdf I didn't do it

The Un-Named:

Well, your either accidentally pressing the touch pad button, or tapping the touch pad it’s self, else it’s acting up and think something is touching it. Try to disable it and contact the laptop’s manufacturer if it’s still in warranty.

to add to this, try using a USB mouse for now on.
